column4: i download the new klamav and i do not know how to install it
i download the new klamav and i do not know how to install it
i download the new klamav and i do not know how to install it
please don't repeat
what filesystem?
Paladine told you the command above
you use chown
but why do you want to own /home?
you mounted a new drive over your existing /home?
I would just reboot
what do you mean you did the same thing?  What thing did you do?
but when you reboot, everything should be back to normal.  Unless you edited fstab, did you do that?
try to prepend my nick to your responds, otherwise I might miss them
you shouldn't edit it, right now you are trying to unmount the partition you mounted to /home right?  If that's the case, just reboot
after you reboot the drive won't be mounted anymore
yes, that is why I am suggesting you reboot.  rebooting should unmount it for you
no?  Did you reboot and it didn't work?
ok can you post on pastebin the output from this command: mount && cat /etc/fstab

pastebin is a site where you can post large amounts of text, the url is paste.ubuntu-nl.org .  Just put the command I gave you and then paste the output on pastebin.  After that, give us the URL for the post
type 'man chown', it is the manual for the chown command.  You type commands in applications > accessories > terminal
if I wanted to make the file /home/jasonr/notex.txt owned by the user 'jrib', I would type: sudo chown jrib:jrib /home/jasonr/notes.txt
